modName: Tales Of Trash And Treasure - SPERG Edition
summary: Part of an inventory sorter that I am working on, this stand-alone 'plugin' covers the clutter that SPERG makes recyclable.
descriptionHtml:
Part of an inventory sorter that I am working on, this stand-alone 'plugin' covers the clutter that SPERG makes recyclable by means of an aesthetic (to me anyway) renaming of the item, if needed, and the addition of "Salvage:" to the beginning of the line, grouping all of your SPERG recyclables in one place. SPERG made more Dwemer metal smeltable, but I left the tagging of the vanilla metals out of this mod as they are going to be renamed in the full "Tales Of Trash And Treasure" nventory mod that I will be putting up on its own page when completed.

There are two files available, the 'core' file, which covers the applicable clutter from the game without requiring DLCs and the "Semi-Legendary" patch file which [b]requires[/b] both Dawnguard and Dragonborn as well as the core file (SPERG didn't touch Hearthfires). [b]Both files require SPERG to be installed.[/b] You can get it here: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24445/?

These files are (eventually) meant to supplement the main "Tales Of Trash & Treasure" inventory overhaul mod that I am working on, but I made this a stand-alone rather than a truly dependent plugin for people who might just want the SPERG recyclables sorted while leaving the rest of their sorting alone.

While making this mod, I had another inventory sorting mod installed as well, and this mod played fine with it - you just need to make sure to place this mod AFTER any other inventory sorters in your load list in order for the changes I have made to 'win out'.

Also, this looks best under SkyUI. I have not seen what it looks like in the vanilla menu.

Many thanks to seorin for SPERG. By far my favorite perk and crafting overhaul combo by far.
author: Chaophim
